name: Theresia Hvorslev
biography:
Swedish silver designer. Known for silver hollow ware, tableware, cutlery, and jewelry.
Theresia Hvorslev attended the Konstfackskolan (University College of Arts & Crafts and Design) in Stockholm and then apprenticed at Georg Jensen in Copenhagen, and Bernadotte & Bjørn. She studied goldsmithing from Sven-Arne Gilgren, chief designer at the Swedish company GAB (G Dahlgren & Co.).  She became a jewelry designer and received several awards for her work. Hvorsley worked in Germany and Denmark between 1955 and 1960 and later returned to Sweden where she opened her own studio in 1964. She designed pieces for Alton and Mema and the Swedish royal family. Hvorsley has produced a public sculpture for her hometown of Lidkøping, and designed cutlery for SAS (Scandinavian Airline System) which is still in use today.
